trans-unit.source: Indicates that the implementing message sink will be provided by dynamically registered properties.

Dynamic message sinks are provided with notifications of call start and call finish with flags indicating whether the call is currently on the client side or server side (this is useful for the context level sinks).
Indicates that a call is returning.

The Boolean parameters indicate whether the sink is located on the client side or the server side and whether the call is using the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessageSink.AsyncProcessMessage%2A> method.

A value of <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the method is invoked on the client side and <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if it is invoked on the server side.
A value of <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this is an asynchronic call and <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if it is a synchronic call.
Indicates that a call is starting.

The Boolean parameters indicate whether the sink is located on the client side or the server side and whether the call is using the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessageSink.AsyncProcessMessage%2A> method.

A value of <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the method is invoked on the client side and <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if the method is on the server side.
A value of <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this is an asynchronic call and <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if it is a synchronic call.
